titleStmt.title: Rueben Munday et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9323

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the underassigned citizens would most Respectfuly Represent to your Excellency that John Powell was at the last June term of the Jackson Circuit Court Sentenced to the penitentiary for the term of two years (charged with steeling a hog) the Testimoney only scircumstantially some evidence to the favor of Powell, we will say to you that Powell has left a large family without any means to surport on And we are of the opinion that if you will parden Powell that you will only confirm the opinion of a large Majority of the citizens of said county in his innocense as there was much fulling on the part of the commonwealths witneses manifested on the trial
